member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is alive.
member.value: true if this instance is alive; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Caliburn.Core.MemoryManagement.WeakReference`1.Target
member.summary: Gets or sets the object (the target) referenced by the current object.
member.returns: null if the object referenced by the current object has been garbage collected; otherwise, a reference to the object referenced by the current object.
member.exception: The reference to the target object is invalid. This exception can be thrown while setting this property if the value is a null reference or if the object has been finalized during the set operation.

member.name: T:Caliburn.Core.MemoryManagement.WeakKeyComparer`1
member.summary: Compares objects of the given type or WeakKeyReferences to them for equality based on the given comparer. Note that we can only implement IEqualityComparer{T} for T = object as there is no other common base between T and WeakKeyReference{T}. We need a single comparer to handle both types because we don't want to allocate a new weak reference for every lookup.

member.name: M:Caliburn.Core.MemoryManagement.WeakKeyComparer`1.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer{`0})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Returns a hash code for the specified object.
member.param: The for which a hash code is to be returned.
member.returns: A hash code for the specified object.
member.exception: The type of is a reference type and is null.

member.name: M:Caliburn.Core.MemoryManagement.WeakKeyComparer`1.Equals(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified objects are equal.
member.param: The first object of type to compare.
The second object of type to compare.
member.returns: true if the specified objects are equal; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Caliburn.Core.MemoryManagement.WeakKeyedDictionary`2
member.summary: A generic dictionary, which allows its keys to be garbage collected if there are no other references to them than from the dictionary itself.
member.remarks: If the key of a particular entry in the dictionary has been collected, then both the key and value become effectively unreachable. However, left-over WeakReference objects for the key and value will physically remain in the dictionary until RemoveCollectedEntries is called. This will lead to a discrepancy between the Count property and the number of iterations required to visit all of the elements of the dictionary using its enumerator or those of the Keys and Values collections. Similarly, CopyTo will copy fewer than Count elements in this situation.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

When this method returns, the value associated with the specified key, if the key is found; otherwise, the default value for the type of the parameter. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if the object that implements contains an element with the specified key; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Caliburn.Core.MemoryManagement.WeakKeyedDictionary`2.RemoveCollectedEntries
member.summary: Removes the left-over weak references for entries in the dictionary whose key has already been reclaimed by the garbage collector. This will reduce the dictionary's Count by the number of dead key-value pairs that were eliminated.

member.name: P:Caliburn.Core.MemoryManagement.WeakKeyedDictionary`2.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of elements contained in the .
member.returns: The number of elements contained in the .
member.remarks: WARNING: The count returned here may include entries for which either the key or value objects have already been garbage collected. Call RemoveCollectedEntries to weed out collected entries and update the count accordingly.
